resources.string: Tâmpa is a mountain, part of the Postăvarul Massif, located in the southern part of the Eastern Carpathians and almost entirely surrounded by the city of Braşov.
Longtime zoo on 25 acres offering visitors a unique lions\' den view, a reptile house & a playground.
Outdoor adventure park by a lake offering forest-lined ropes & zipline courses for all levels.
Poiana Brașov is a neighborhood of Brasov and one of the most popular Romanian ski resort. It\'s an important tourist centre preferred by many tourists not only from Romania, but also from Italy,

Bran Castle, situated near Bran and in the immediate vicinity of Brașov, is a national monument and landmark in Romania. The fortress is situated on the border between Transylvania and Wallachia, on DN73.
Brașovia Citadel was a fortification located on the top of Tâmpa mountain in Brașov, Romania. It was demolished until the beginning of 1455 from the order of Iancu de Hunedoara.
Black Church or Biserica Neagră is a church in Brașov, a city in south-eastern Transylvania, Romania
Built in the 15th century, this restored watchtower with a stone staircase houses a museum.
Movie theater in Coresi Shopping Resort, Brașov, Romania
Experience the most intense 60 minutes at the only high-tech escape room in Brasov!
